Ubuntu 17.10 Desktop Installation

Posted on December 17, 2017 by Kartik B. under Linux Basics

Ubuntu is an open source operating system for computers. It is a Linux distribution based on the Debian architecture.In this guide we will be learning how to install ubuntu on your PC.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 

  • 2 GHz dual core processor or better
  • 2 GB system memory
  • 25 GB of free hard drive space
  • An USB Drive
  • A USB port for the installer media
  • Internet access is helpful

STEP 1.1 — DOWNLOADING THE ISO 

First we need to download the ISO of ubuntu 17.10 from the official website.

Type in https://www.ubuntu.com/ , Go to Downloads page and select Desktop.

You will see the two options the 16.04.x LTS release (LTS Stands for Long Term Support ) and the 17.10 release , go ahead and download the 17.10 one by clicking the Download button

STEP 1.2 — BURNING THE ISO 

 

In order to burn the iso in the pen drive, we need Rufus (Rufus is a utility that helps format and create bootable USB flash drives, such as USB keys/pendrives, memory sticks, etc.) 

Type in https://rufus.akeo.ie/ and download the latest version (which in my case is 2.18).

Open the tool and select the USB device you want from the drop down menu. 

Click the CD icon in front where FreeDOS is written. Select the ISO file you downloaded , and click start at the bottom.

This finishes the part 1 of this guide

STEP 2 — INSTALLING UBUNTU-17.10

Plug the USB drive in the PC you want to install ubuntu and boot your system with above prepared bootable media.

You will be prompted with the following screen :

 

In the next window, select “Install Ubuntu” option.

 

STEP 3 — INSTALLING UPDATES DURING INSTALLATION

 

In case your system is connected to the Internet, then select both options to install latest updates, third party and multimedia software during the installation else you can leave them unchecked ,

In my case I will be checking the first one only

STEP 4 — SELECTING THE INSTALLATION TYPE

 

 

Select Erase disks and Install Ubuntu.In case you need to dual boot or select the partition in which you need to install ubuntu, see STEP 4.1

Click Install Now.There will be a pop-up screen prompting you about writing to disk, Click Continue

 

STEP 4.1 — IN CASE YOU ARE DUAL BOOTING

 

 

Select Something else

 

 

You probably can now see partitions up on your disk, Select the partition you want to install ubuntu in.

*** In case you don’t have a partition ready for ubuntu installation, boot up to your installed OS, and shrink the the partition to create a new one for ubuntu installation. 

Double Tap the partition.

 

 

Select use as Ext4 journaling file system and select mount point as “/” that is root directory. Check the format partition. It will look like this

 

Click OK and Install Now

 

STEP 5 — SELECTING RESPECTIVE TIME ZONE AND KEYBOARD LAYOUT

Select your time zone and click continue

Select your keyboard layout and click continue

STEP 6 — THE USER NAME AND SYSTEM’S NAME

Input all the values and click continue

STEP 6 — PROGRESS OF INSTALLATION

At this step, Installation of Ubuntu 17.10 would have been started and should be in progress.

Once the installation is completed, installer will prompt you to restart your system.

Click on Restart Now , you will be booted to Ubuntu 

That’s it for this guide of installing ubuntu. Hope you had fun installing it with us
